result.execSummary:
The defendant Teare M Weiss was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: May transfer probation to Washington County.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are ordered. Sign releases for agent. Inform agent of all prescriptions.
Expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all costs/fees and no new criminal law violations.

No Contct with the Kohl's Store listed in the criminal complaint or any witnesses. Maintain employment and/or school combination. Follow through with any treatment or counseling recommended by agent. 
**Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: Non-working hours (Huber). Release for standard conditions. STAYED for use at agent's discretion. May be served in Washington County if imposed.
To be completed as a condition of probation, as directed by agent.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Teare M Weiss

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Teare M Weiss in court with Attorney Daniel Mcmurray.  Stephen Joseph Centinario appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called for sentencing hearing.  State gives sentencing recommendations.  Attorney Mcmurray makes statements regarding sentencing.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #1:  IMPOSED AND STAYED SENTENCE OF:

--- 75 DAYS HUBER

TERM OF PROBATION:  1 YEAR   **transfer allowed to Washington County**

CONDITIONS OF PROBATON:  
____AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
____Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
____No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs 
____No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
____Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are 
prescribed/sign releases.
____Inform Agent of all prescriptions
____Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
____Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
____No contact with: Kohls store listed in criminal complaint or any witnesses
____20 hours of community service 

COSTS:  $253.00 & $200.00 DNA surcharge (to be paid as a condition of probation)

**Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.**

CONDITION TIME:  30 Days, Non-working hours with standard release conditions - STAYED - to be used at agent's discretion.  May be served in Washington County.

***Expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all costs/fees and no new criminal law violations***
Sentencing hearing on March 9, 2017 at 02:00 pm.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Teare M Weiss in court with Attorney Daniel Mcmurray.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Barry Braatz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count #1.  Court performs plea colloquy and finds Defendant guilty of Count #1. Attorney McMurray requests a sentencing date.   Bail remains as fixed.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for March 9, 2017 at 02:00 pm.

Jury status hearing scheduled for January 5, 2017 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for January 10, 2017 at 08:30 am.
